column4: and does asnyone know how to cancel the on mount fsck disk check thing so when i run through 30 reboots in 5 hours of trying to get my webcam to work i dont have to sit through 15 minutes of disk checks?
you shouldn't need to reboot.  There are commands to load kernel modules on the fly.  Search for that.
they dont work. grrr when a programme using the webcam crashes i have to reboot no kill -9 no modprobe -r nothing will free up tyhat webcam except a reboot
a little investment of time now, will save you much in the future.
i have to reboot for the 15th freaking time today so those are hollow words
I did tell you that you dont have to reboot to load kernel modules
not load kernel modules but UNLOAD them
the modules loaded and stuck loaded and cheese is holdiong it hostage
you can unload them too, afaik.  BUt I dont know the command.
modprobve -r it doesnt work though because it says the things in use
i cant make it not in use though because cheese is keeping it used
try killing the cheese process?
and cheese wont die to a kill -9
no i am a complete idiot who doesnt try obvious things
i have been syaing i tried that
perhaps use a different application, besides cheese?
the only one which seems to have any prmise is vlc but noone here or anywhere else seems to know how to get that to work
try sudoing?
i have to do it via sudobecause i have to run cheese via sudo to get the webcam to work with it
I suggest you use a different webcam app, something that doesn't require sudoing to start.
nope. But I guess I could divert with other suggestions ;)  On my laptop, it skips it when on battery power.
diversion noted and not helpful
sorry abt that.
